text: VII The very day of Mr. Elton 's going to London produced a fresh occasion for Emma 's services towards her friend .
text_tokenized: VII The very day of Mr. Elton 's going to London produced a fresh occasion for Emma 's services towards her friend .

text: Harriet had been at Hartfield , as usual , soon after breakfast ; and , after a time , had gone home to return again to dinner : she returned , and sooner than had been talked of , and with an agitated , hurried look , announcing something extraordinary to have happened which she was longing to tell .
text_tokenized: Harriet had been at Hartfield , as usual , soon after breakfast ; and , after a time , had gone home to return again to dinner : she returned , and sooner than had been talked of , and with an agitated , hurried look , announcing something extraordinary to have happened which she was longing to tell .

text: Half a minute brought it all out .
text_tokenized: Half a minute brought it all out .

text: She had heard , as soon as she got back to Mrs. Goddard 's , that Mr. Martin had been there an hour before , and finding she was not at home , nor particularly expected , had left a little parcel for her from one of his sisters , and gone away ; and on opening this parcel , she had actually found , besides the two songs which she had lent Elizabeth to copy , a letter to herself ; and this letter was from him , from Mr. Martin , and contained a direct proposal of marriage . " Who could have thought it ?
text_tokenized: She had heard , as soon as she got back to Mrs. Goddard 's , that Mr. Martin had been there an hour before , and finding she was not at home , nor particularly expected , had left a little parcel for her from one of his sisters , and gone away ; and on opening this parcel , she had actually found , besides the two songs which she had lent Elizabeth to copy , a letter to herself ; and this letter was from him , from Mr. Martin , and contained a direct proposal of marriage . " Who could have thought it ?

text: She was so surprized she did not know what to do .
text_tokenized: She was so surprized she did not know what to do .

text: Yes , quite a proposal of marriage ; and a very good letter , at least she thought so .
text_tokenized: Yes , quite a proposal of marriage ; and a very good letter , at least she thought so .

text: And he wrote as if he really loved her very much -- but she did not know -- and so , she was come as fast as she could to ask Miss Woodhouse what she should do.-- "
text_tokenized: And he wrote as if he really loved her very much -- but she did not know -- and so , she was come as fast as she could to ask Miss Woodhouse what she should do.-- "

text: Emma was half - ashamed of her friend for seeming so pleased and so doubtful .
text_tokenized: Emma was half - ashamed of her friend for seeming so pleased and so doubtful .

text: " Upon my word , " she cried , " the young man is determined not to lose any thing for want of asking .
text_tokenized: " Upon my word , " she cried , " the young man is determined not to lose any thing for want of asking .

text: He will connect himself well if he can . " " Will you read the letter ? " cried Harriet .
text_tokenized: He will connect himself well if he can . " " Will you read the letter ? " cried Harriet .

text: " Pray do . I 'd rather you would . " Emma was not sorry to be pressed .
text_tokenized: " Pray do . I 'd rather you would . " Emma was not sorry to be pressed .

text: She read , and was surprized .
text_tokenized: She read , and was surprized .

text: The style of the letter was much above her expectation .
text_tokenized: The style of the letter was much above her expectation .

text: There were not merely no grammatical errors , but as a composition it would not have disgraced a gentleman ; the language , though plain , was strong and unaffected , and the sentiments it conveyed very much to the credit of the writer .
text_tokenized: There were not merely no grammatical errors , but as a composition it would not have disgraced a gentleman ; the language , though plain , was strong and unaffected , and the sentiments it conveyed very much to the credit of the writer .

text: It was short , but expressed good sense , warm attachment , liberality , propriety , even delicacy of feeling .
text_tokenized: It was short , but expressed good sense , warm attachment , liberality , propriety , even delicacy of feeling .

text: She paused over it , while Harriet stood anxiously watching for her opinion , with a " Well , well , " and was at last forced to add , " Is it a good letter ? or is it too short ? " " Yes , indeed , a very good letter , " replied Emma rather slowly--"so good a letter , Harriet , that every thing considered , I think one of his sisters must have helped him .

text: I can hardly imagine the young man whom I saw talking with you the other day could express himself so well , if left quite to his own powers , and yet it is not the style of a woman ; no , certainly , it is too strong and concise ; not diffuse enough for a woman .

text: There is no danger of your not being intelligible , which is the first thing .
text_tokenized: There is no danger of your not being intelligible , which is the first thing .

text: Your meaning must be unequivocal ; no doubts or demurs :

text_tokenized: I certainly have been misunderstanding you , if you feel in doubt as to the _ purport _ of your answer .

text: I had imagined you were consulting me only as to the wording of it . " Harriet was silent . With a little reserve of manner , Emma continued : " You mean to return a favourable answer , I collect .

text: Pray , dear Miss Woodhouse , tell me what I ought to do .
text_tokenized: Pray , dear Miss Woodhouse , tell me what I ought to do .

text_tokenized: " I shall not give you any advice , Harriet .

text_tokenized: I will have nothing to do with it .

text: This is a point which you must settle with your feelings .

text: " " I had no notion that he liked me so very much , " said Harriet , contemplating the letter .
text_tokenized: " " I had no notion that he liked me so very much , " said Harriet , contemplating the letter .

text: For a little while Emma persevered in her silence ; but beginning to apprehend the bewitching flattery of that letter might be too powerful , she thought it best to say , " I lay it down as a general rule , Harriet , that if a woman _ doubts _ as to whether she should accept a man or not , she certainly ought to refuse him . If she can hesitate as to ` Yes , ' she ought to say ` No ' directly . It is not a state to be safely entered into with doubtful feelings , with half a heart . I thought it my duty as a friend , and older than yourself , to say thus much to you . But do not imagine that I want to influence you . " " Oh !
text_tokenized: For a little while Emma persevered in her silence ; but beginning to apprehend the bewitching flattery of that letter might be too powerful , she thought it best to say , " I lay it down as a general rule , Harriet , that if a woman _ doubts _ as to whether she should accept a man or not , she certainly ought to refuse him . If she can hesitate as to ` Yes , ' she ought to say ` No ' directly . It is not a state to be safely entered into with doubtful feelings , with half a heart . I thought it my duty as a friend , and older than yourself , to say thus much to you . But do not imagine that I want to influence you . " " Oh !

text: " Not for the world , " said Emma , smiling graciously , " would I advise you either way . You must be the best judge of your own happiness .

text: Emma waited the result with impatience , but not without strong hopes . At last , with some hesitation , Harriet said-- " Miss Woodhouse , as you will not give me your opinion , I must do as well as I can by myself ; and I have now quite determined , and really almost made up my mind -- to refuse Mr. Martin .
text_tokenized: Emma waited the result with impatience , but not without strong hopes . At last , with some hesitation , Harriet said-- " Miss Woodhouse , as you will not give me your opinion , I must do as well as I can by myself ; and I have now quite determined , and really almost made up my mind -- to refuse Mr. Martin .

text: Do you think I am right ? "
text_tokenized: Do you think I am right ? "

text: " Perfectly , perfectly right , my dearest Harriet ; you are doing just what you ought .
text_tokenized: " Perfectly , perfectly right , my dearest Harriet ; you are doing just what you ought .

text: While you were at all in suspense I kept my feelings to myself , but now that you are so completely decided I have no hesitation in approving .
text_tokenized: While you were at all in suspense I kept my feelings to myself , but now that you are so completely decided I have no hesitation in approving .

text: Dear Harriet , I give myself joy of this .
text_tokenized: Dear Harriet , I give myself joy of this .

text: It would have grieved me to lose your acquaintance , which must have been the consequence of your marrying Mr. Martin .
text_tokenized: It would have grieved me to lose your acquaintance , which must have been the consequence of your marrying Mr. Martin .

text: While you were in the smallest degree wavering , I said nothing about it , because I would not influence ; but it would have been the loss of a friend to me .
text_tokenized: While you were in the smallest degree wavering , I said nothing about it , because I would not influence ; but it would have been the loss of a friend to me .

text: I could not have visited Mrs. Robert Martin , of Abbey - Mill Farm .
text_tokenized: I could not have visited Mrs. Robert Martin , of Abbey - Mill Farm .

text: Now I am secure of you for ever . " Harriet had not surmised her own danger , but the idea of it struck her forcibly . " You could not have visited me ! " she cried , looking aghast .
text_tokenized: Now I am secure of you for ever . " Harriet had not surmised her own danger , but the idea of it struck her forcibly . " You could not have visited me ! " she cried , looking aghast .

text: " No , to be sure you could not ; but I never thought of that before . That would have been too dreadful!--What an escape!--Dear Miss Woodhouse , I would not give up the pleasure and honour of being intimate with you for any thing in the world . " " Indeed , Harriet , it would have been a severe pang to lose you ; but it must have been .
text_tokenized: " No , to be sure you could not ; but I never thought of that before . text: I must have given you up .

text: " Dear me!--How should I ever have borne it !
text_tokenized: " Dear me!--How should I ever have borne it !

text: It would have killed me never to come to Hartfield any more ! "
text_tokenized: It would have killed me never to come to Hartfield any more ! "

text: " " I do not think he is conceited either , in general , " said Harriet , her conscience opposing such censure ; " at least , he is very good natured , and I shall always feel much obliged to him , and have a great regard for -- but that is quite a different thing from -- and you know , though he may like me , it does not follow that I should -- and certainly I must confess that since my visiting here I have seen people -- and if one comes to compare them , person and manners , there is no comparison at all , _ one _ is so very handsome and agreeable .

text: Emma assured her there would be no difficulty in the answer , and advised its being written directly , which was agreed to , in the hope of her assistance ; and though Emma continued to protest against any assistance being wanted , it was in fact given in the formation of every sentence . The looking over his letter again , in replying to it , had such a softening tendency , that it was particularly necessary to brace her up with a few decisive expressions ; and she was so very much concerned at the idea of making him unhappy , and thought so much of what his mother and sisters would think and say , and was so anxious that they should not fancy her ungrateful , that Emma believed if the young man had come in her way at that moment , he would have been accepted after all .
text_tokenized: Emma assured her there would be no difficulty in the answer , and advised its being written directly , which was agreed to , in the hope of her assistance ; and though Emma continued to protest against any assistance being wanted , it was in fact given in the formation of every sentence .
